description:
Nova essex setup with ESXi hypervisor.

Instance provisioning on ESX is done only on a single datastore (first datastore of ESX) , even though there are multiple datastores present.

Currently, there is no way to specify the datastore to be used while provisioning an instance.
title: Multi datastore support for provisioning of instances on ESX

comments.content:
Nova essex setup with ESXi hypervisor.

Instance provisioning on ESX is done only on a single datastore(first datastore of ESX) , even though there are multiple datastores present.

If the utilization of datastore is complete, then the instance goes into error state.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~guduru-sirisha

comments.content:
Working on this bug. 

Currently, there is no way to specify the datastore on which instance has to be provisioned. The use of regex to choose a datastore will fix this issue. The fix proposed for bug 1171930 addresses the capacity issue with datastores, hence that will not be fixed here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smurugesan

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/30822
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
The approach is as follows :-

1. The user may specify a regex as a parameter (vmware_datastore_regex) through nova.conf file.
2. If specified, the regex is used in the selection of a datastore while provisioning an instance. 
3. If not specified, the default behavior to choose the first datastore prevails. 

This fix enables a user to whitelist or blacklist a set of datastores for provisioning instances.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smurugesan

comments.content:
Approach is as follows :-

1. The user may specify a regex as a parameter (vmwareapi_datastore_regex) in nova.conf 
2. If specified, the regex is used to select a datastore from the cluster at the time of provisioning an instance
3. If not, the default behavior to choose the first datastore prevails.

This enables an user to whitelist or blacklist a set of datastores.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smurugesan

comments.content: Solution proposed is resolving only a part of the bug and not resolving the problem "If the utilization of datastore is complete, then the instance goes into error state".  Should there be any dependency added on bug 1171930 solution to mark this complete? or Should we change the description of this bug?
